Details.Textbox24: The University of California is one of the world's foremost research and teaching institutions, and UC Davis is the system’s flagship campus for environmental and sustainability studies. UC Davis is a global leader in studies relating to air and water pollution; water and land use; agricultural practices; endangered species management; invasive plants and animals; climate change; resource economics; information technology; and human society and culture. Located in the Sacramento Valley, the campus has four colleges, six professional schools, over 31,000 students, and, with 5,300 acres, is the largest of the UC campuses (www.ucdavis.edu).
Details.Textbox41: One Shields Avenue Davis, California US
Details.Textbox73: Reporting Protocol: General Reporting Protocol 2.1 and associated updates and clarifications

Source Emissions | WAPA Electricity - RECs - Market Based 43,057 offsite RECs were retired and applied to the WAPA electricity totals. REC retirement certification is attached as a supporting document. 1,542.12 Green-e RECs were purchased for LEED credits and also applied to WAPA totals. LEED submittals are provided as supporting documents.
Source Emissions | Wastewater Treatment Plant-Effluent Discharge Calculation from section 10.3.2.3 of Local Government Operations Protocol, May 2010. Equation 10.9

Source Emissions | Wastewater Treatment Plant-Lagoons The UC Davis WWTP process is largely aerobic and removes more than 95% of BOD5 (Fp), thus the calculation from section 10.3.1.2 of the Local Government Operations Protocol, May 2010, uses Fp=.95 to account for the operation of the WWTP.

Source Emissions | Wastewater Treatment Plant-Nitrification/Denitrification Calculation from section 10.3.2.1 of Local Government Operations Protocol, May 2010.The campus population for the 2015-2016 school year was used since 2 of the 3 quarters of the 2015-2016 school year fall in 2016
